qas.question: Which NATO country feared a unified and rearmed Germany?
Memories of what occupation were fading by 1954?
France had no fear of what country?
Which parliament rejected the EDC on 30 April 1954?
Which country wanted to keep Germany militarily against the West?

context: Memories of the <b1_0>Nazi<b1_0/> occupation were still strong, and the rearmament of <b2_0>Germany<b2_0/> was feared by <a0_0>France<a0_0/> too. On 30 August 1954 <b3_0>French<b3_0/> Parliament rejected the EDC, thus ensuring its failure and blocking a major objective of US policy towards Europe: to associate Germany militarily with the West. The <b4_0>US<b4_0/> Department of State started to elaborate alternatives: Germany would be invited to join NATO or, in the case of French obstructionism, strategies to circumvent a French veto would be implemented in order to obtain a German rearmament outside NATO.
